citation.title: Comparative genomics and transcriptomics to identify genetic mechanisms underlying the emergence of carbapenem resistant Acinetobacter baumannii (CRAb).

comment.text: Genetic information processing; DNA replication.
Belongs to the ribonucleoside diphosphate reductase small chain family.
The sequence shown here is derived from an EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ whole genome shotgun (WGS) entry which is preliminary data.

property.value: F:ribonucleoside-diphosphate reductase activity, thioredoxin disulfide as acceptor

citation.title: Comparative genomics and transcriptomics to identify genetic mechanisms underlying the emergence of carbapenem resistant Acinetobacter baumannii (CRAb).

comment.text: Iron-storage protein, whose ferroxidase center binds Fe(2+) ions, oxidizes them by dioxygen to Fe(3+), and participates in the subsequent Fe(3+) oxide mineral core formation within the central cavity of the protein complex.
Belongs to the bacterioferritin family.
The sequence shown here is derived from an EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ whole genome shotgun (WGS) entry which is preliminary data.

citation.title: Comparative genomics and transcriptomics to identify genetic mechanisms underlying the emergence of carbapenem resistant Acinetobacter baumannii (CRAb).

comment.text: Catalyzes the hydroxylation of 2-nonaprenyl-3-methyl-6-methoxy-1,4-benzoquinol during ubiquinone biosynthesis.

reaction.text: a 6-methoxy-3-methyl-2-all-trans-polyprenyl-1,4-benzoquinol + AH2 + O2 = A + a 3-demethylubiquinol + H2O

comment.text: Binds 2 iron ions per subunit.
Cofactor biosynthesis; ubiquinone biosynthesis.
Belongs to the COQ7 family.
The sequence shown here is derived from an EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ whole genome shotgun (WGS) entry which is preliminary data.

comment.text: Provides the precursors necessary for DNA synthesis. Catalyzes the biosynthesis of deoxyribonucleotides from the corresponding ribonucleotides.
Binds 2 iron ions per subunit.
